newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post business - April 24.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post business - April 24.

text.p: The Washington Post carried the following items on the front page of its business section on April 24:

WASHINGTON - US Airways Inc. reported record first-quarter earnings of $131.8 million but warned that unless it quickly received contract concessions from its three major unions the company would soon be forced to downsize the airline.

NEW YORK - The chairmen of Congress's tax-writing committees are certainly not making new friends on Wall Street these days with their move to end tax-free treatment when one corporation spins off a subsidiary to another corporation.
WASHINGTON - The House passed legislation that would revamp the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office.

WASHINGTON - The National Science Foundation said it will not renew Network Solutions Inc.'s deal to register Internet domains when the Herndon, Va. company's agreement with the government expires next year.
WASHINGTON - Prince George's County officials want to pump up the local economy and are looking to business leaders to do the bulk of the heavy lifting.
